availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Allen Waller Sipple (Grant County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Marietta Collins Sipple in Grant County, Kentucky, on April 14, 1845. Father of College M. Sipple, Sarah F. Sipple, Junietta Sipple, Marius Sipple, Martha Sipple, Nancy Sipple, William A. Sipple, and Leslie C. Sipple. Farmer in Grant County in 1850. Employed Ebenezer Stone as a laborer in Grant County in 1850. Farmer in Grant County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 318B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 884.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Flat Creek, p. 541B.
Find A Grave, "Allen Waller Sipple (Jun 23, 1819-Oct 13, 1899)," Memorial #47257223, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47257223 (accessed May 3, 2020).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Grant County Marriages, Film #001490815, p. 51.
